|> Image
    src=images/microwave-ovens/microwave-oven.jpg
    alt=A microwave with 18 buttons labeled in Japanese.
    width=3072
    height=2304
    credit=[from Flickr]{link|url=https://flic.kr/p/5LQHa9} by [Jeremy Hall]{link|url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/wallslide/} under [CC BY 2.0]{link|url=https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/}, cropped
    caption=Even if the controls are labeled in a foreign language, I should be able to cook my food.

The only thing that I need to set is the time that my food should cook. I do not need more controls.

Any extra button will make it harder to figure out, which controls to use to set the time. Maybe I can get used to and remember the right buttons, but why not make it stupidly simple?

|> Heading
    How to fix it

Have a turning knob like a cooking timer.

You can add a second turning knob for setting the power, but it should by styled in a way that the timer knob is the only important control.

    src=images/microwave-ovens/good.png
